channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2024090103
item.description:
Report E-2024090103

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-08T09:12:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-04
  • City: MENOMONEE FALLS
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During unloading operations at the Menomonee Falls 10-Day Facility, staff discovered a leak from a 5-gallon container of lithium preserved in mineral oil inside a trailer. The spill was limited to less than 2 gallons and remained confined within the trailer. Upon investigation, it was determined that the leak occurred due to improper securing of the load, which allowed the containers to shift during transportation. The spill was remediated by trained Veolia personnel and the container was properly closed.

item.title: Report X-2024090224
item.description:
Report X-2024090224

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-05T09:13:49+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-23
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER CLEANED UP A LEAKING PACKAGE ON THE PINK SIDE BOX LINE. 6/6 CANS OF ADHESIVE CLEANER WERE LEAKING DUE TO LOOSE CAPS. ONE CAP WAS EVEN COMPLETELY OFF THE BOTTLE. UPON OPENING AND INSPECTING THE PACKAGE THE INNER PACKAGING WAS FOUND TO HAVE LIMITED QUANTITY MARKINGS AND PAINT UN1263 CLASS 3 PG III. THE OUTER PACKAGING DID NOT HAVE ANY LIMITED QUANTITY MARKINGS. RMP WAS NOTIFIED AND CONTACTED THE HAZMAT HELP DESK.

item.title: Report E-2024080747
item.description:
Report E-2024080747

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-02T09:14:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-03
  • City: STURTEVANT
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifteen (15) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift puncture that impacted the trailer floor and concrete terminal floor. Dayton personnel deployed granular absorbent to the impacted areas and gathered the spent material and containerized the absorbents into one (1) 10-gallon poly pail and the damaged 55-gallon drum was overpacked into one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
